content.question: The function <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>g</mi></math> has a continuous second derivative. If <math alttext="g of 0 equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></math>, <math alttext="g prime of 0 equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math>, <math alttext="g of 3 equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></math>, and <math alttext="g prime of 3 equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="the integral from 0 to 3, of, x times g double prime of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo largeop="true">⋅</mo><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>″</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 6.11: (BC ONLY) Integrating Using Integration by Parts

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
